epd_metadata.program_operator_address: 315a Hardy Street Nelson 7010 AUSTRALASIA New Zealand
epd_metadata.product_category_rules: PCR 2012:01 Construction Products and Construction Services, Version 2.3, 2018-11-15
epd_metadata.independent_third_party_verification: EPD process certification and data, according to ISO 14025:2006

product_description.product_name: ViroDecs" Ready-mix concrete - Dubbo Rail Maintenance Facility
product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging
product_description.classification: Non-Dangerous Goods according to the Australian Code for the Transport of Dangerous Goods by Road and Rail
product_description.hazard_information: Safety data sheet for pre-mixed concrete lists all associated hazard phrases

lca_information.reference_service_life: Not specified (scope is from cradle to gate)
lca_information.time_representativeness: Plant data based on 2017 calendar year production data; mix data based on 2021 calendar year production data
databases_and_software_used: Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI) (2017)
World Business Council for Sustainable Development (WBCSD) Cement Sustainability Initiative (CSI) Tool Project Database (International Version) (2018)
Product specific EPDs for admixtures and fibres
lca_information.allocation: Inputs and outputs allocated physically based on weight (quarries) or m² of concrete (batching plant); economic allocation used when physical allocation not possible; fly ash and silica fumes assumed burden-free; ground granulated blast furnace slag allocated economically
lca_information.cut_off_criteria: No flows excluded on the basis of cut-off criteria

data_quality.foreground_data: Medium or higher geographic and temporal representativeness
data_quality.background_data: Updated within 10 years as required under PCR 2012:01

lca_information.system_boundaries: Cradle to gate; excludes life cycle stages beyond Holcim's gate; excludes environmental impacts relating to personnel, infrastructure and production equipment not directly consumed in the process

transport_and_installation.packaging_waste: Included in background data; packaging waste researched and modeled

end_of_life.description: Not included in the LCA scope; described for whole-of-life building studies
scenarios: Disposal of concrete at landfill site
Reuse of recovered concrete elements in new construction works
Use of concrete debris in land restoration
Crushing/recycling of concrete: substitution of primary material or natural aggregates in fresh concrete
end_of_life.note: Scenarios 2, 3 and 4 can result in benefits and loads outside system boundary and should be considered in whole-of-life studies

carbon_emission_context.global_warming_potential: Provided in detailed tables per mix code (e.g., kg CO2 eq values)
carbon_emission_context.carbonation: Not considered in this EPD; carbonation is natural CO2 absorption by concrete over its lifetime which can offset cement manufacturing emissions
carbon_emission_context.note: Carbonation calculation standardized in BS EN 16757:2017 and recommended for whole-of-life studies

recycled_materials_handling.allocation_approach: According to PCR 2012:01; fly ash and silica fume treated as waste with transport impacts only; slag allocated economically due to significant economic value
recycled_materials_handling.background_data: Default background data from LCA databases used; AusLCI dataset conforms to EN 15804 allocation requirements

resource_use: Use of renewable primary energy excluding renewable primary energy resources used as raw materials (PERE)
Use of renewable primary energy resources used as raw materials (PERM)
Total use of renewable primary energy resources (PERT)
Use of non-renewable primary energy excluding non-renewable primary energy resources used as raw materials (PENRE)
Use of non-renewable primary energy resources used as raw materials (PENRM)
Total use of non-renewable primary energy resources (PENRT)
